intro: Oxylobium retusum var. minus, commonly known as the dwarf oxylobium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in spring. The variety 'minus' is distinguished by its smaller size and reduced foliage compared to the typical form.
